e19-4yp-Classification-of-Motor-Imagery-.title: Classification of Motor Imagery EEG based Tasks for Brain Computer Interfacing Applications
e19-4yp-Classification-of-Motor-Imagery-.description: This project focuses on classifying single-joint motor imagery (MI) EEG signals for applications in Brain-Computer-Interfacing(BCI). By leveraging deep learning models—including CNNs, Transformers, and hybrid architectures—we aim to improve the usability of MI-based single-joint classification.

e19-4yp-Dynamic-Multi-Dimensional-Resour.title: Dynamic Multi Dimensional Resource Orchestration in Kubernetes
e19-4yp-Dynamic-Multi-Dimensional-Resour.description: This repo focuses on latency-aware resource optimization for Kubernetes

e19-4yp-Extending-the-Growing-Self-Organ.title: Extending the Growing Self Organizing Map for Unsupervised Learning Based Modelling
e19-4yp-Extending-the-Growing-Self-Organ.description: This research aims to expand the capabilities of the Growing Self-Organizing Map (GSOM) by focusing on its applications in data analytics and knowledge discovery

e19-4yp-Multi-Modal-Data-Fusion-for-Trad.title: Multi Modal Data Fusion for Trading Market Price Forecasting

e19-4yp-Putting-Privacy-into-Practice.title: Putting Privacy into Practice
e19-4yp-Putting-Privacy-into-Practice.description: This is a research project that suggests a serious game design framework for software developers to embed privacy practices when developing software applications

e19-4yp-Quality-Assessment-of-Final-Root.title: Quality Assessment of Final Root Canal Treatment Using Intra Oral Periapical Radiographs
e19-4yp-Quality-Assessment-of-Final-Root.description: This study addresses dental practice's challenge of evaluating root canal treatment quality. Current evaluation depends on subjective dentist judgment, lacking standardized criteria. here we developing an AI-based method using deep learning to automate and standardize the evaluation process.

e19-4yp-Using-LMs-to-Write-Patient-Clini.title: Using LMs to Write Patient Clinical Letters
e19-4yp-Using-LMs-to-Write-Patient-Clini.description: This research project aims to explore the potential of language models (LMs) in automating the writing of patient clinical letters.
